    6. 
            

            

            module Repositories
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            

            

              # Database implementation of event storage using DomainEvent model
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            

            

              class EventRepository
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            

            

                include StoragePort
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            

            

            
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            

            

                require "securerandom"
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            

            

            
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            

            

                def initialize
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            

            

                  # Use memory as a cache, not primary storage
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            

            

                  @events_cache = {}
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            

            

                end
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            

            

            
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            

            

                # Save an event to the database
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            

            

                #
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            

            

                # @param event [Domain::Event] The event to save
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            

            

                # @return [Domain::Event] The saved event
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            

            

                def save_event(event)
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            

            

                  ActiveRecord::Base.transaction do
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            

            

                    # Ensure we have a valid UUID for aggregate_id
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            

            

                    # The source might not be in UUID format, so we'll use a valid UUID
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            

            

                    # based on the source string if necessary
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            

            

                    aggregate_id = valid_uuid?(event.source) ? event.source : generate_uuid_from_string(event.source)
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            

            

            
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            

            

                    # Create a record in the database
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            

            

                    record = DomainEvent.new(
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            

            

                      aggregate_id: aggregate_id,
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            

            

                      event_type: event.name,
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            

            

                      payload: event.data
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            

            

                      # position is auto-generated by DB sequence
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            

            

                      # created_at will be set automatically
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            

            

                      # IMPORTANT: Never set record.id manually, always let the database auto-generate it
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            

            

                    )
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            

            

            
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            

            

                    record.save!
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            

            

            
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            

            

                    # Always create a new domain event with the database-generated ID using the factory
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            

            

                    new_event = Domain::EventFactory.create(
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            

            

                      id: record.id.to_s,
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            

            

                      name: event.name,
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            

            

                      source: event.source,
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            

            

                      data: event.data,
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            

            

                      timestamp: record.created_at
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            

            

                    )
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            

            

            
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            

            

                    # Cache the event
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            

            

                    @events_cache[new_event.id] = new_event
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            

            

            
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            

            

                    Rails.logger.debug { "Event persisted to database: #{new_event.id}, position: #{record.position}" }
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            

            

                    new_event
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            

            

                  end
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            

            

                rescue ActiveRecord::RecordInvalid => e
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            

            

                  Rails.logger.error("Failed to save event: #{e.message}")
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            

            

                  raise "Failed to save event: #{e.message}"
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            

            

                end
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            

            

            
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            

            

                # Find an event by ID
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            

            

                #
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            

            

                # @param id [String, Integer, Hash] The ID of the event to find
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            

            

                # @return [Domain::Event, nil] The event if found, nil otherwise
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            

            

                def find_event(id)
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            

            

                  # Handle the case where a hash is passed
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            

            

                  id = id["id"] if id.is_a?(Hash) && id.key?("id")
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            

            

            
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            

            

                  # Always convert to string for cache lookup
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            

            

                  id_str = id.to_s
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            

            

            
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            

            

                  # Try to fetch from cache first
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            

            

                  return @events_cache[id_str] if @events_cache.key?(id_str)
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            

            

            
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            

            

                  # Check if this is a UUID - if so, find by aggregate_id
          
      76. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    76. 
            

            

                  if valid_uuid?(id_str)
          
      77. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    77. 
            

            

                    Rails.logger.debug { "Looking up event by UUID: #{id_str}" }
          
      78. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    78. 
            

            

                    record = DomainEvent.find_by(aggregate_id: id_str)
          
      79. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    79. 
            

            

            
          
      80. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    80. 
            

            

                    # If not found by aggregate_id, try one more approach
          
      81. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    81. 
            

            

                    unless record
          
      82. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    82. 
            

            

                      # Try to find all events and check if any has this UUID as a string ID
          
      83. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    83. 
            

            

                      # This is a fallback mechanism
          
      84. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    84. 
            

            

                      DomainEvent.all.each do |evt|
          
      85. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    85. 
            

            

                        if evt.id.to_s == id_str
          
      86. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    86. 
            

            

                          record = evt
          
      87. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    87. 
            

            

                          break
          
      88. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    88. 
            

            

                        end
          
      89. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    89. 
            

            

                      end
          
      90. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    90. 
            

            

                    end
          
      91. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    91. 
            

            

                  elsif id_str.match?(/^\d+$/)
          
      92. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    92. 
            

            

                    # If it's a numeric string, try to find by database ID
          
      93. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    93. 
            

            

                    Rails.logger.debug { "Looking up event by numeric ID: #{id_str}" }
          
      94. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    94. 
            

            

                    record = DomainEvent.find_by(id: id_str.to_i)
          
      95. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    95. 
            

            

                  else
          
      96. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    96. 
            

            

                    # Otherwise, try both approaches
          
      97. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    97. 
            

            

                    Rails.logger.debug { "Looking up event by ID (mixed strategy): #{id_str}" }
          
      98. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    98. 
            

            

                    record = DomainEvent.find_by(id: id_str)
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            

            

                    record ||= DomainEvent.find_by(aggregate_id: id_str)
          
      100. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    100. 
            

            

                  end
          
      101. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    101. 
            

            

            
          
      102. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    102. 
            

            

                  return nil unless record
          
      103. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    103. 
            

            

            
          
      104. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    104. 
            

            

                  # Convert to domain event using the factory and cache
          
      105. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    105. 
            

            

                  domain_event = Domain::EventFactory.from_record(record)
          
      106. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    106. 
            

            

                  @events_cache[domain_event.id] = domain_event
          
      107. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    107. 
            

            

                  Rails.logger.debug { "Found event: #{domain_event.id} (#{domain_event.name})" }
          
      108. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    108. 
            

            

                  domain_event
          
      109. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    109. 
            

            

                end
          
      110. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    110. 
            

            

            
          
      111. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    111. 
            

            

                # Event store specific operations
          
      112. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    112. 
            

            

                def append_event(aggregate_id:, event_type:, payload:)
          
      113. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    113. 
            

            

                  ActiveRecord::Base.transaction do
          
      114. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    114. 
            

            

                    # Ensure we have a valid UUID for aggregate_id
          
      115. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    115. 
            

            

                    valid_aggregate_id = valid_uuid?(aggregate_id) ? aggregate_id : generate_uuid_from_string(aggregate_id)
          
      116. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    116. 
            

            

            
          
      117. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    117. 
            

            

                    # Create a record in the database
          
      118. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    118. 
            

            

                    record = DomainEvent.create!(
          
      119. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    119. 
            

            

                      aggregate_id: valid_aggregate_id,
          
      120. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    120. 
            

            

                      event_type: event_type,
          
      121. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    121. 
            

            

                      payload: payload
          
      122. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    122. 
            

            

                      # position is auto-generated by DB sequence
          
      123. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    123. 
            

            

                      # created_at will be set automatically
          
      124. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    124. 
            

            

                    )
          
      125. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    125. 
            

            

            
          
      126. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    126. 
            

            

                    # Convert to domain event using the factory
          
      127. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    127. 
            

            

                    domain_event = Domain::EventFactory.from_record(record)
          
      128. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    128. 
            

            

            
          
      129. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    129. 
            

            

                    # Cache the event
          
      130. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    130. 
            

            

                    @events_cache[domain_event.id] = domain_event
          
      131. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    131. 
            

            

            
          
      132. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    132. 
            

            

                    domain_event
          
      133. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    133. 
            

            

                  end
          
      134. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    134. 
            

            

                end
          
      135. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    135. 
            

            

            
          
      136. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    136. 
            

            

                def read_events(from_position: 0, limit: nil)
          
      137. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    137. 
            

            

                  # Query the database
          
      138. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    138. 
            

            

                  query = DomainEvent.since_position(from_position).chronological
          
      139. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    139. 
            

            

                  query = query.limit(limit) if limit
          
      140. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    140. 
            

            

            
          
      141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    141. 
            

            

                  # Convert to domain events and cache them
          
      142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    142. 
            

            

                  query.map do |record|
          
      143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    143. 
            

            

                    # Check cache first
          
      144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    144. 
            

            

                    event_id = record.id.to_s
          
      145. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    145. 
            

            

                    @events_cache[event_id] ||= Domain::EventFactory.from_record(record)
          
      146. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    146. 
            

            

                  end
          
      147. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    147. 
            

            

                end
          
      148. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    148. 
            

            

            
          
      149. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    149. 
            

            

                def read_stream(aggregate_id:, from_position: 0, limit: nil)
          
      150. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    150. 
            

            

                  # Query the database for events of a specific aggregate
          
      151. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    151. 
            

            

                  valid_aggregate_id = valid_uuid?(aggregate_id) ? aggregate_id : generate_uuid_from_string(aggregate_id)
          
      152. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    152. 
            

            

            
          
      153. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    153. 
            

            

                  query = DomainEvent.for_aggregate(valid_aggregate_id)
          
      154. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    154. 
            

            

                                     .since_position(from_position)
          
      155. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    155. 
            

            

                                     .chronological
          
      156. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    156. 
            

            

            
          
      157. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    157. 
            

            

                  query = query.limit(limit) if limit
          
      158. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    158. 
            

            

            
          
      159. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    159. 
            

            

                  # Convert to domain events and cache them
          
      160. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    160. 
            

            

                  query.map do |record|
          
      161. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    161. 
            

            

                    # Check cache first
          
      162. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    162. 
            

            

                    event_id = record.id.to_s
          
      163. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    163. 
            

            

                    @events_cache[event_id] ||= Domain::EventFactory.from_record(record)
          
      164. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    164. 
            

            

                  end
          
      165. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    165. 
            

            

                end
          
      166. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    166. 
            

            

            
          
      167. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    167. 
            

            

                private
          
      168. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    168. 
            

            

            
          
      169. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    169. 
            

            

                # Check if a string is a valid UUID
          
      170. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    170. 
            

            

                def valid_uuid?(string)
          
      171. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    171. 
            

            

                  uuid_regex = /^[0-9a-f]{8}-[0-9a-f]{4}-[0-9a-f]{4}-[0-9a-f]{4}-[0-9a-f]{12}$/i
          
      172. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    172. 
            

            

                  uuid_regex.match?(string.to_s)
          
      173. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    173. 
            

            

                end
          
      174. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    174. 
            

            

            
          
      175. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    175. 
            

            

                # Generate a deterministic UUID from a string
          
      176. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    176. 
            

            

                def generate_uuid_from_string(string)
          
      177. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    177. 
            

            

                  # Simply use a random UUID for now
          
      178. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    178. 
            

            

                  # In a production system, you might want to use a more deterministic approach
          
      179. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    179. 
            

            

                  # such as a namespace UUID (v5) if available
          
      180. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    180. 
            

            

                  SecureRandom.uuid
          
      181. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    181. 
            

            

                end
          
      182. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    182. 
            

            

              end
          
      183. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    183. 
            

            

            end
          
      184.

              class MetricRepository

                def initialize
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            

            

                  @metrics_cache = {} # In-memory cache for tests
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            

            

                end
          
      12.

                def save_metric(metric)
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            

            

                  # Create a database record
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            

            

                  domain_metric = DomainMetric.create!(
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            

            

                    name: metric.name,
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            

            

                    value: metric.value,
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            

            

                    source: metric.source,
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            

            

                    dimensions: metric.dimensions,
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            

            

                    recorded_at: metric.timestamp
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            

            

                  )
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            

            

            
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            

            

                  # Log the created metric ID
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            

            

                  Rails.logger.debug { "Created metric in database with ID: #{domain_metric.id}" }
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            

            

            
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            

            

                  # Update the domain metric with the database ID if needed
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            

            

                  if metric.id.nil? || metric.id.empty?
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            

            

                    Rails.logger.debug { "Updating metric with database ID: #{domain_metric.id}" }
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            

            

                    metric = metric.with_id(domain_metric.id.to_s)
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            

            

                  end
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            

            

            
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            

            

                  # Make sure we actually have an ID
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            

            

                  Rails.logger.error { "Metric still has nil/empty ID after save attempt" } if metric.id.nil? || metric.id.empty?
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            

            

            
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            

            

                  # Store in memory cache for tests
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            

            

                  @metrics_cache[metric.id] = metric
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            

            

            
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            

            

                  Rails.logger.debug { "Returning metric with ID: #{metric.id}" }
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            

            

            
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            

            

                  # Return the domain metric
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            

            

                  metric
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            

            

                end
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            

            

            
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            

            

                def find_metric(id)
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            

            

                  # Log the ID we're trying to find
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            

            

                  Rails.logger.debug { "Finding metric with ID: #{id}" }
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            

            

            
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            

            

                  # Normalize the ID to string
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            

            

                  id_str = id.to_s
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            

            

            
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            

            

                  # Try to find in memory cache first (for tests)
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            

            

                  if @metrics_cache.key?(id_str)
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            

            

                    Rails.logger.debug { "Found metric in cache: #{id_str}" }
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            

            

                    return @metrics_cache[id_str]
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            

            

                  end
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            

            

            
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            

            

                  # Find in database - for composite primary key, we need to use find_by
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            

            

                  begin
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            

            

                    # Get a fresh database connection from the pool
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            

            

                    ActiveRecord::Base.connection_pool.with_connection do |conn|
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            

            

                      # Since metrics has a composite primary key (id, recorded_at),
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            

            

                      # we need a more specific approach
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            

            

                      Rails.logger.debug { "Using composite key approach for metric lookup" }
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            

            

            
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            

            

                      # Try to find by ID only (ignoring the recorded_at part of composite key)
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            

            

                      domain_metric = DomainMetric.find_by_id_only(id_str.to_i)
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            

            

            
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            

            

                      # If not found, try a direct query
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            

            

                      if domain_metric.nil?
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            

            

                        Rails.logger.debug { "Trying direct query for metric ID: #{id_str.to_i}" }
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            

            

                        begin
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            

            

                          id_int = id_str.to_i
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            

            

                          sql = "SELECT id, name, value, source, dimensions::text as dimensions_text, recorded_at FROM metrics WHERE id = ? ORDER BY recorded_at DESC LIMIT 1"
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            

            

                          result = conn.exec_query(sql, "Direct Metric Lookup", [id_int])
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            

            

            
          
      76. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    76. 
            

            

                          if result.rows.any?
          
      77. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    77. 
            

            

                            # Parse the results
          
      78. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    78. 
            

            

                            record = result.to_a.first
          
      79. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    79. 
            

            

            
          
      80. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    80. 
            

            

                            # Parse JSONB data
          
      81. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    81. 
            

            

                            dimensions = {}
          
      82. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    82. 
            

            

                            if record["dimensions_text"].present?
          
      83. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    83. 
            

            

                              begin
          
      84. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    84. 
            

            

                                dimensions = JSON.parse(record["dimensions_text"])
          
      85. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    85. 
            

            

                              rescue JSON::ParserError => e
          
      86. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    86. 
            

            

                                Rails.logger.error { "Failed to parse dimensions JSON: #{e.message}" }
          
      87. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    87. 
            

            

                                dimensions = {}
          
      88. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    88. 
            

            

                              end
          
      89. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    89. 
            

            

                            end
          
      90. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    90. 
            

            

            
          
      91. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    91. 
            

            

                            # Create the domain model directly
          
      92. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    92. 
            

            

                            metric = Domain::Metric.new(
          
      93. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    93. 
            

            

                              id: record["id"].to_s,
          
      94. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    94. 
            

            

                              name: record["name"],
          
      95. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    95. 
            

            

                              value: record["value"].to_f,
          
      96. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    96. 
            

            

                              source: record["source"],
          
      97. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    97. 
            

            

                              dimensions: dimensions,
          
      98. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    98. 
            

            

                              timestamp: record["recorded_at"]
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            

            

                            )
          
      100. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    100. 
            

            

            
          
      101. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    101. 
            

            

                            # Cache for future lookups
          
      102. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    102. 
            

            

                            @metrics_cache[metric.id] = metric
          
      103. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    103. 
            

            

            
          
      104. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    104. 
            

            

                            Rails.logger.debug { "Created metric from direct SQL: #{metric.id} (#{metric.name})" }
          
      105. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    105. 
            

            

                            return metric
          
      106. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    106. 
            

            

                          end
          
      107. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    107. 
            

            

                        rescue StandardError => e
          
      108. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    108. 
            

            

                          Rails.logger.error { "Error in direct database query: #{e.message}" }
          
      109. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    109. 
            

            

                          Rails.logger.error { e.backtrace.join("\n") }
          
      110. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    110. 
            

            

                        end
          
      111. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    111. 
            

            

                      end
          
      112. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    112. 
            

            

            
          
      113. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    113. 
            

            

                      unless domain_metric
          
      114. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    114. 
            

            

                        Rails.logger.warn { "Metric not found in database: #{id_str}" }
          
      115. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    115. 
            

            

                        return nil
          
      116. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    116. 
            

            

                      end
          
      117. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    117. 
            

            

            
          
      118. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    118. 
            

            

                      Rails.logger.debug { "Found metric in database: #{domain_metric.id} (#{domain_metric.name})" }
          
      119. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    119. 
            

            

            
          
      120. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    120. 
            

            

                      # Convert to domain model
          
      121. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    121. 
            

            

                      metric = Domain::Metric.new(
          
      122. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    122. 
            

            

                        id: domain_metric.id.to_s,
          
      123. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    123. 
            

            

                        name: domain_metric.name,
          
      124. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    124. 
            

            

                        value: domain_metric.value,
          
      125. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    125. 
            

            

                        source: domain_metric.source,
          
      126. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    126. 
            

            

                        dimensions: domain_metric.dimensions || {},
          
      127. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    127. 
            

            

                        timestamp: domain_metric.recorded_at
          
      128. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    128. 
            

            

                      )
          
      129. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    129. 
            

            

            
          
      130. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    130. 
            

            

                      # Cache for future lookups
          
      131. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    131. 
            

            

                      @metrics_cache[metric.id] = metric
          
      132. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    132. 
            

            

            
          
      133. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    133. 
            

            

                      return metric
          
      134. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    134. 
            

            

                    end
          
      135. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    135. 
            

            

                  rescue ActiveRecord::StatementInvalid, ActiveRecord::RecordNotFound => e
          
      136. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    136. 
            

            

                    Rails.logger.error { "Database error finding metric #{id_str}: #{e.message}" }
          
      137. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    137. 
            

            

                    nil
          
      138. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    138. 
            

            

                  end
          
      139. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    139. 
            

            

                end
          
      140. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    140. 
            

            

            
          
      141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    141. 
            

            

                def list_metrics(filters = {})
          
      142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    142. 
            

            

                  # Start with a base query
          
      143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    143. 
            

            

                  query = DomainMetric.all
          
      144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    144. 
            

            

            
          
      145. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    145. 
            

            

                  # Apply filters
          
      146. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    146. 
            

            

                  query = query.with_name(filters[:name]) if filters[:name]
          
      147. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    147. 
            

            

                  query = query.since(filters[:start_time]) if filters[:start_time]
          
      148. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    148. 
            

            

                  query = query.until(filters[:end_time]) if filters[:end_time]
          
      149. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    149. 
            

            

                  query = query.latest_first if filters[:latest_first]
          
      150. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    150. 
            

            

                  query = query.limit(filters[:limit]) if filters[:limit]
          
      151. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    151. 
            

            

            
          
      152. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    152. 
            

            

                  # Convert to domain models
          
      153. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    153. 
            

            

                  query.map do |domain_metric|
          
      154. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    154. 
            

            

                    Domain::Metric.new(
          
      155. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    155. 
            

            

                      id: domain_metric.id.to_s,
          
      156. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    156. 
            

            

                      name: domain_metric.name,
          
      157. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    157. 
            

            

                      value: domain_metric.value,
          
      158. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    158. 
            

            

                      source: domain_metric.source,
          
      159. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    159. 
            

            

                      dimensions: domain_metric.dimensions || {},
          
      160. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    160. 
            

            

                      timestamp: domain_metric.recorded_at
          
      161. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    161. 
            

            

                    )
          
      162. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    162. 
            

            

                  end
          
      163. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    163. 
            

            

                end
          
      164. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    164. 
            

            

            
          
      165. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    165. 
            

            

                def get_average(name, start_time = nil, end_time = nil)
          
      166. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    166. 
            

            

                  DomainMetric.average_for(name, start_time, end_time)
          
      167. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    167. 
            

            

                end
          
      168. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    168. 
            

            

            
          
      169. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    169. 
            

            

                def get_percentile(name, percentile, start_time = nil, end_time = nil)
          
      170. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    170. 
            

            

                  DomainMetric.percentile_for(name, percentile, start_time, end_time)
          
      171. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    171. 
            

            

                end
          
      172. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    172. 
            

            

            
          
      173. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    173. 
            

            

                # New method to find metrics by name and dimensions
          
      174. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    174. 
            

            

                # @param name [String] The metric name to search for
          
      175. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    175. 
            

            

                # @param dimensions [Hash] The dimensions to filter by
          
      176. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    176. 
            

            

                # @param start_time [Time] Optional start time to filter metrics
          
      177. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    177. 
            

            

                # @return [Array<Domain::Metric>] Array of matching metrics
          
      178. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    178. 
            

            

                def find_metrics_by_name_and_dimensions(name, dimensions, start_time = nil)
          
      179. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    179. 
            

            

                  # Start with a base query for the name
          
      180. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    180. 
            

            

                  query = DomainMetric.where(name: name)
          
      181. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    181. 
            

            

            
          
      182. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    182. 
            

            

                  # Add dimension filters using PostgreSQL JSONB containment operator
          
      183. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    183. 
            

            

                  # This ensures we find metrics where dimensions contain at least the provided key-value pairs
          
      184. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    184. 
            

            

                  if dimensions.present?
          
      185. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    185. 
            

            

                    normalized_dimensions = dimensions.transform_keys(&:to_s)
          
      186. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    186. 
            

            

                    query = query.where("dimensions @> ?", normalized_dimensions.to_json)
          
      187. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    187. 
            

            

                  end
          
      188. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    188. 
            

            

            
          
      189. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    189. 
            

            

                  # Add time range if provided
          
      190. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    190. 
            

            

                  query = query.where("recorded_at >= ?", start_time) if start_time
          
      191. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    191. 
            

            

            
          
      192. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    192. 
            

            

                  # Order by most recent first
          
      193. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    193. 
            

            

                  query = query.order(recorded_at: :desc)
          
      194. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    194. 
            

            

            
          
      195. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    195. 
            

            

                  # Convert to domain models
          
      196. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    196. 
            

            

                  query.map do |domain_metric|
          
      197. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    197. 
            

            

                    Domain::Metric.new(
          
      198. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    198. 
            

            

                      id: domain_metric.id.to_s,
          
      199. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    199. 
            

            

                      name: domain_metric.name,
          
      200. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    200. 
            

            

                      value: domain_metric.value,
          
      201. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    201. 
            

            

                      source: domain_metric.source,
          
      202. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    202. 
            

            

                      dimensions: domain_metric.dimensions || {},
          
      203. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    203. 
            

            

                      timestamp: domain_metric.recorded_at
          
      204. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    204. 
            

            

                    )
          
      205. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    205. 
            

            

                  end
          
      206. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    206. 
            

            

                end
          
      207. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    207. 
            

            

            
          
      208. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    208. 
            

            

                # Find an aggregate metric by name and dimensions
          
      209. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    209. 
            

            

                # @param name [String] The aggregate metric name
          
      210. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    210. 
            

            

                # @param dimensions [Hash] The dimensions to match
          
      211. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    211. 
            

            

                # @return [Domain::Metric, nil] The matching metric or nil if not found
          
      212. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    212. 
            

            

                def find_aggregate_metric(name, dimensions)
          
      213. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    213. 
            

            

                  # Normalize dimensions for search
          
      214. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    214. 
            

            

                  normalized_dimensions = dimensions.transform_keys(&:to_s)
          
      215. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    215. 
            

            

            
          
      216. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    216. 
            

            

                  # Start with a query for metrics with this name
          
      217. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    217. 
            

            

                  domain_metrics = DomainMetric.where(name: name)
          
      218. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    218. 
            

            

            
          
      219. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    219. 
            

            

                  # Filter by exact dimension match using PostgreSQL JSONB containment operators
          
      220. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    220. 
            

            

                  # We want the dimensions to exactly match both ways (metric contains all dims AND dims contain all metric)
          
      221. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    221. 
            

            

                  domain_metrics = domain_metrics.where(
          
      222. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    222. 
            

            

                    "dimensions @> ? AND ? @> dimensions",
          
      223. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    223. 
            

            

                    normalized_dimensions.to_json,
          
      224. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    224. 
            

            

                    normalized_dimensions.to_json
          
      225. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    225. 
            

            

                  )
          
      226. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    226. 
            

            

            
          
      227. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    227. 
            

            

                  # Get the most recent one
          
      228. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    228. 
            

            

                  domain_metric = domain_metrics.order(recorded_at: :desc).first
          
      229. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    229. 
            

            

            
          
      230. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    230. 
            

            

                  # If found, convert to domain model and return
          
      231. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    231. 
            

            

                  return nil unless domain_metric
          
      232. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    232. 
            

            

            
          
      233. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    233. 
            

            

                  Domain::Metric.new(
          
      234. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    234. 
            

            

                    id: domain_metric.id.to_s,
          
      235. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    235. 
            

            

                    name: domain_metric.name,
          
      236. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    236. 
            

            

                    value: domain_metric.value,
          
      237. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    237. 
            

            

                    source: domain_metric.source,
          
      238. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    238. 
            

            

                    dimensions: domain_metric.dimensions || {},
          
      239. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    239. 
            

            

                    timestamp: domain_metric.recorded_at
          
      240. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    240. 
            

            

                  )
          
      241. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    241. 
            

            

                end
          
      242. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    242. 
            

            

            
          
      243. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    243. 
            

            

                # Update an existing metric
          
      244. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    244. 
            

            

                # @param metric [Domain::Metric] The metric to update
          
      245. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    245. 
            

            

                # @return [Domain::Metric] The updated metric
          
      246. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    246. 
            

            

                def update_metric(metric)
          
      247. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    247. 
            

            

                  # Ensure we have an ID
          
      248. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    248. 
            

            

                  if metric.id.nil? || metric.id.empty?
          
      249. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    249. 
            

            

                    Rails.logger.error { "Cannot update metric without ID" }
          
      250. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    250. 
            

            

                    return save_metric(metric) # Fall back to creating a new one
          
      251. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    251. 
            

            

                  end
          
      252. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    252. 
            

            

            
          
      253. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    253. 
            

            

                  # Find the database record
          
      254. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    254. 
            

            

                  begin
          
      255. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    255. 
            

            

                    domain_metric = DomainMetric.find_by_id_only(metric.id.to_i)
          
      256. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    256. 
            

            

            
          
      257. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    257. 
            

            

                    if domain_metric
          
      258. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    258. 
            

            

                      # Update the values
          
      259. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    259. 
            

            

                      domain_metric.update!(
          
      260. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    260. 
            

            

                        value: metric.value,
          
      261. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    261. 
            

            

                        dimensions: metric.dimensions,
          
      262. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    262. 
            

            

                        recorded_at: metric.timestamp
          
      263. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    263. 
            

            

                      )
          
      264. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    264. 
            

            

            
          
      265. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    265. 
            

            

                      # Update the cache
          
      266. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    266. 
            

            

                      @metrics_cache[metric.id] = metric
          
      267. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    267. 
            

            

            
          
      268. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    268. 
            

            

                      Rails.logger.debug { "Updated metric: #{metric.id} (#{metric.name})" }
          
      269. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    269. 
            

            

                      metric
          
      270. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    270. 
            

            

                    else
          
      271. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    271. 
            

            

                      # If not found, create a new one
          
      272. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    272. 
            

            

                      Rails.logger.warn { "Metric #{metric.id} not found for update, creating new" }
          
      273. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    273. 
            

            

                      save_metric(metric)
          
      274. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    274. 
            

            

                    end
          
      275. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    275. 
            

            

                  rescue StandardError => e
          
      276. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    276. 
            

            

                    Rails.logger.error { "Error updating metric #{metric.id}: #{e.message}" }
          
      277. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    277. 
            

            

                    Rails.logger.error { e.backtrace.join("\n") }
          
      278. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    278. 
            

            

                    save_metric(metric) # Fall back to creating a new one
          
      279. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    279. 
            

            

                  end
          
      280. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    280. 
            

            

                end
          
      281. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    281. 
            

            

            
          
      282. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    282. 
            

            

                # Find unique values for a particular field in metric dimensions
          
      283. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    283. 
            

            

                # @param metric_name [String] The metric name to search in
          
      284. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    284. 
            

            

                # @param dimensions [Hash] Base dimensions to filter by
          
      285. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    285. 
            

            

                # @param value_field [String] The dimension field to extract unique values from
          
      286. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    286. 
            

            

                # @return [Array] Array of unique values
          
      287. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    287. 
            

            

                def find_unique_values(metric_name, dimensions, value_field)
          
      288. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    288. 
            

            

                  # Get all metrics matching criteria
          
      289. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    289. 
            

            

                  metrics = find_metrics_by_name_and_dimensions(metric_name, dimensions)
          
      290. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    290. 
            

            

            
          
      291. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    291. 
            

            

                  # Extract unique values for the specified field
          
      292. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    292. 
            

            

                  metrics.map { |m| m.dimensions[value_field.to_s] || m.dimensions[value_field.to_sym] }
          
      293. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    293. 
            

            

                         .compact
          
      294. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    294. 
            

            

                         .uniq
          
      295. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    295. 
            

            

                end
          
      296. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    296. 
            

            

              end
          
      297. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    297. 
            

            

            end
          
      298.

    app/adapters/web/web_adapter.rb

    0.0% lines covered

    120 relevant lines. 0 lines covered and 120 lines missed. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1. 
            

            

            # frozen_string_literal: true
          
      2. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    2. 
            

            

            
          
      3.
