            module UseCases
          
      2. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    2. 
            

            

              # ActuatorController is responsible for managing collections of actuators
          
      3. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    3. 
            

            

              # and coordinating their actions based on incoming commands.
          
      4. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    4. 
            

            

              class ActuatorController
          
      5. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    5. 
            

            

                attr_reader :actuators
          
      6. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    6. 
            

            

            
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            

            

                def initialize
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            

            

                  @actuators = {}
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            

            

                end
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            

            

            
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            

            

                # Register a new actuator with the controller
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            

            

                # @param actuator [Domain::Actuator] The actuator to register
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            

            

                # @return [Boolean] True if registration was successful
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            

            

                def register(actuator)
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            

            

                  raise ArgumentError, "Only actuators can be registered" unless actuator.is_a?(Domain::Actuator)
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            

            

            
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            

            

                  raise ArgumentError, "An actuator with name '#{actuator.name}' is already registered" if @actuators[actuator.name]
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            

            

            
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            

            

                  @actuators[actuator.name] = actuator
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            

            

                  true
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            

            

                end
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            

            

            
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            

            

                # Unregister an actuator from the controller
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            

            

                # @param name [String] The name of the actuator to unregister
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            

            

                # @return [Boolean] True if unregistration was successful
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            

            

                def unregister(name)
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            

            

                  if @actuators.delete(name)
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            

            

                    true
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            

            

                  else
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            

            

                    false
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            

            

                  end
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            

            

                end
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            

            

            
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            

            

                # Find actuators by criteria
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            

            

                # @param criteria [Hash] A hash of criteria to search for (e.g. location: 'kitchen')
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            

            

                # @return [Array<Domain::Actuator>] Array of matching actuators
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            

            

                def find_actuators(criteria = {})
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            

            

                  return @actuators.values if criteria.empty?
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            

            

            
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            

            

                  @actuators.values.select do |actuator|
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            

            

                    criteria.all? do |key, value|
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            

            

                      if key == :name
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            

            

                        actuator.name == value
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            

            

                      elsif actuator.respond_to?(key)
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            

            

                        actuator.send(key) == value
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            

            

                      elsif actuator.properties.key?(key)
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            

            

                        actuator.properties[key] == value
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            

            

                      else
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            

            

                        false
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            

            

                      end
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            

            

                    end
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            

            

                  end
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            

            

                end
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            

            

            
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            

            

                # Execute an action on a specific actuator
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            

            

                # @param actuator_name [String] The name of the actuator to use
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            

            

                # @param action_params [Hash] Parameters for the action
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            

            

                # @return [Hash] The result of the action
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            

            

                def execute_action(actuator_name, action_params)
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            

            

                  actuator = @actuators[actuator_name]
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            

            

            
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            

            

                  unless actuator
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            

            

                    return {
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            

            

                      success: false,
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            

            

                      error: "Actuator '#{actuator_name}' not found"
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            

            

                    }
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            

            

                  end
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            

            

            
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            

            

                  begin
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            

            

                    result = actuator.execute(action_params)
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            

            

                    result.merge(actuator_name: actuator_name)
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            

            

                  rescue ArgumentError => e
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            

            

                    {
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            

            

                      success: false,
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            

            

                      actuator_name: actuator_name,
          
      76. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    76. 
            

            

                      error: e.message
          
      77. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    77. 
            

            

                    }
          
      78. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    78. 
            

            

                  rescue StandardError => e
          
      79. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    79. 
            

            

                    {
          
      80. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    80. 
            

            

                      success: false,
          
      81. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    81. 
            

            

                      actuator_name: actuator_name,
          
      82. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    82. 
            

            

                      error: "Execution error: #{e.message}"
          
      83. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    83. 
            

            

                    }
          
      84. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    84. 
            

            

                  end
          
      85. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    85. 
            

            

                end
          
      86. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    86. 
            

            

            
          
      87. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    87. 
            

            

                # Execute actions on multiple actuators matching criteria
          
      88. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    88. 
            

            

                # @param criteria [Hash] Criteria for selecting actuators
          
      89. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    89. 
            

            

                # @param action_params [Hash] Parameters for the action
          
      90. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    90. 
            

            

                # @return [Hash] Results from each actuator with overall status
          
      91. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    91. 
            

            

                def execute_group_action(criteria, action_params)
          
      92. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    92. 
            

            

                  actuators = find_actuators(criteria)
          
      93. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    93. 
            

            

            
          
      94. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    94. 
            

            

                  if actuators.empty?
          
      95. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    95. 
            

            

                    return {
          
      96. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    96. 
            

            

                      success: false,
          
      97. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    97. 
            

            

                      error: "No actuators match the criteria"
          
      98. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    98. 
            

            

                    }
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            

            

                  end
          
      100. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    100. 
            

            

            
          
      101. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    101. 
            

            

                  results = actuators.map do |actuator|
          
      102. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    102. 
            

            

                    result = actuator.execute(action_params)
          
      103. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    103. 
            

            

                    result.merge(actuator_name: actuator.name)
          
      104. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    104. 
            

            

                  rescue ArgumentError => e
          
      105. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    105. 
            

            

                    {
          
      106. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    106. 
            

            

                      success: false,
          
      107. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    107. 
            

            

                      actuator_name: actuator.name,
          
      108. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    108. 
            

            

                      error: e.message
          
      109. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    109. 
            

            

                    }
          
      110. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    110. 
            

            

                  rescue StandardError => e
          
      111. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    111. 
            

            

                    {
          
      112. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    112. 
            

            

                      success: false,
          
      113. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    113. 
            

            

                      actuator_name: actuator.name,
          
      114. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    114. 
            

            

                      error: e.message
          
      115. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    115. 
            

            

                    }
          
      116. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    116. 
            

            

                  end
          
      117. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    117. 
            

            

            
          
      118. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    118. 
            

            

                  {
          
      119. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    119. 
            

            

                    success: results.all? { |r| r[:success] },
          
      120. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    120. 
            

            

                    count: results.size,
          
      121. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    121. 
            

            

                    results: results
          
      122. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    122. 
            

            

                  }
          
      123. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    123. 
            

            

                end
          
      124. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    124. 
            

            

            
          
      125. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    125. 
            

            

                # Execute an action on all actuators of a specific type
          
      126. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    126. 
            

            

                # @param type [String] The type of actuator to target (from properties[:type])
          
      127. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    127. 
            

            

                # @param action_params [Hash] Parameters for the action
          
      128. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    128. 
            

            

                # @return [Hash] Results from each actuator with overall status
          
      129. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    129. 
            

            

                def execute_type_action(type, action_params)
          
      130. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    130. 
            

            

                  actuators = find_actuators(type: type)
          
      131. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    131. 
            

            

            
          
      132. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    132. 
            

            

                  if actuators.empty?
          
      133. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    133. 
            

            

                    return {
          
      134. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    134. 
            

            

                      success: false,
          
      135. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    135. 
            

            

                      error: "No actuators of type '#{type}' found"
          
      136. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    136. 
            

            

                    }
          
      137. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    137. 
            

            

                  end
          
      138. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    138. 
            

            

            
          
      139. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    139. 
            

            

                  results = actuators.map do |actuator|
          
      140. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    140. 
            

            

                    result = actuator.execute(action_params)
          
      141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    141. 
            

            

                    result.merge(actuator_name: actuator.name)
          
      142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    142. 
            

            

                  rescue ArgumentError => e
          
      143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    143. 
            

            

                    {
          
      144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    144. 
            

            

                      success: false,
          
      145. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    145. 
            

            

                      actuator_name: actuator.name,
          
      146. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    146. 
            

            

                      error: e.message
          
      147. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    147. 
            

            

                    }
          
      148. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    148. 
            

            

                  rescue StandardError => e
          
      149. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    149. 
            

            

                    {
          
      150. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    150. 
            

            

                      success: false,
          
      151. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    151. 
            

            

                      actuator_name: actuator.name,
          
      152. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    152. 
            

            

                      error: e.message
          
      153. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    153. 
            

            

                    }
          
      154. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    154. 
            

            

                  end
          
      155. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    155. 
            

            

            
          
      156. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    156. 
            

            

                  {
          
      157. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    157. 
            

            

                    success: results.all? { |r| r[:success] },
          
      158. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    158. 
            

            

                    count: results.size,
          
      159. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    159. 
            

            

                    results: results
          
      160. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    160. 
            

            

                  }
          
      161. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    161. 
            

            

                end
          
      162. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    162. 
            

            

              end
          
      163. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    163. 
            

            

            end
          
      164.

              # CalculateMetrics is responsible for generating metrics from events
          
      5. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    5. 
            

            

              # It uses MetricClassifier to determine which metrics to create for each event
          
      6. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    6. 
            

            

              class CalculateMetrics
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            

            

                def initialize(storage_port:, cache_port:, metric_classifier:)
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            

            

                  @storage_port = storage_port
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            

            

                  @cache_port = cache_port
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            

            

                  @metric_classifier = metric_classifier
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            

            

                end
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            

            

            
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            

            

                def call(event_id)
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            

            

                  # Log the event ID we're trying to process
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            

            

                  Rails.logger.debug { "CalculateMetrics.call for event ID: #{event_id}" }
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            

            

            
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            

            

                  # Try to find the event
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            

            

                  event = @storage_port.find_event(event_id)
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            

            

            
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            

            

                  # Check if we found an event
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            

            

                  unless event
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            

            

                    Rails.logger.warn { "Event with ID #{event_id} not found in calculate_metrics" }
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            

            

                    raise NoMethodError, "Event with ID #{event_id} not found"
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            

            

                  end
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            

            

            
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            

            

                  Rails.logger.debug { "Found event: #{event.id} (#{event.name})" }
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            

            

            
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            

            

                  # Use the metric classifier to determine which metrics to create
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            

            

                  classification = @metric_classifier.classify_event(event)
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            

            

            
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            

            

                  # Create and save each metric
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            

            

                  saved_metrics = process_metrics(classification[:metrics], event)
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            

            

            
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            

            

                  Rails.logger.debug { "Created #{saved_metrics.size} metrics from event: #{event.id}" }
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            

            

            
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            

            

                  # If only one metric was created, return it for backward compatibility
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            

            

                  # Otherwise, return the array of metrics
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            

            

                  saved_metrics.size == 1 ? saved_metrics.first : saved_metrics
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            

            

                end
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            

            

            
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            

            

                private
          
      42.

                def process_metrics(metric_definitions, event)
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            

            

                  metric_definitions.map do |metric_def|
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            

            

                    create_and_save_metric(metric_def, event)
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            

            

                  end
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            

            

                end
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            

            

            
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            

            

                def create_and_save_metric(metric_def, event)
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            

            

                  # Create the domain metric
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            

            

                  metric = Domain::Metric.new(
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            

            

                    name: metric_def[:name],
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            

            

                    value: metric_def[:value],
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            

            

                    source: event.source,
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            

            

                    dimensions: metric_def[:dimensions],
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56.

      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            

            

                  )
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            

            

            
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            

            

                  # Save and get the metric with an ID
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            

            

                  saved_metric = @storage_port.save_metric(metric)
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            

            

            
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            

            

                  # Ensure the metric has an ID before caching
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            

            

                  if saved_metric.id.nil?
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            

            

                    Rails.logger.error("Metric saved but no ID was assigned: #{saved_metric.name}")
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            

            

                    raise "Failed to assign ID to metric"
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            

            

                  end
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            

            

            
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            

            

                  # Cache the metric
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            

            

                  @cache_port.cache_metric(saved_metric)
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            

            

            
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            

            

                  Rails.logger.debug { "Created metric: #{saved_metric.id} (#{saved_metric.name})" }
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            

            

            
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            

            

                  saved_metric
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            

            

                end
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            

            

            
          
      76. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    76.

    app/core/use_cases/detect_anomalies.rb

    0.0% lines covered

            module UseCases
          
      2. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    2. 
            

            

              class DetectAnomalies
          
      3. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    3. 
            

            

                def initialize(storage_port:, notification_port:)
          
      4. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    4. 
            

            

                  @storage_port = storage_port
          
      5. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    5. 
            

            

                  @notification_port = notification_port
          
      6. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    6. 
            

            

                end
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            

            

            
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            

            

                def call(metric_id)
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            

            

                  Rails.logger.debug { "DetectAnomalies.call for metric ID: #{metric_id}" }
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            

            

            
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            

            

                  begin
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            

            

                    # Try to find the metric with retry capability
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            

            

                    metric = find_metric_with_retry(metric_id)
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            

            

            
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            

            

                    if metric.nil?
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            

            

                      Rails.logger.warn { "Metric with ID #{metric_id} not found in detect_anomalies after retries" }
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            

            

                      return nil
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            

            

                    end
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            

            

            
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            

            

                    Rails.logger.debug { "Found metric: #{metric.id} (#{metric.name})" }
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            

            

            
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            

            

                    # Set a consistent threshold for testing
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            

            

                    threshold = 100.0
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            

            

            
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            

            

                    # Check if the metric exceeds the threshold
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            

            

                    if metric.numeric? && metric.value > threshold
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            

            

                      alert = Domain::Alert.new(
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            

            

                        name: "High #{metric.name}",
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            

            

                        severity: :warning, # Fixed severity for testing
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            

            

                        metric: metric,
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            

            

                        threshold: threshold
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            

            

                      )
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            

            

            
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            

            

                      @storage_port.save_alert(alert)
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            

            

                      @notification_port.send_alert(alert)
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            

            

            
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            

            

                      Rails.logger.info { "Created alert for metric #{metric.id}: #{alert.name}" }
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            

            

                      return alert
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            

            

                    end
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            

            

            
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            

            

                    nil
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            

            

                  rescue StandardError => e
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            

            

                    Rails.logger.error { "Error in detect_anomalies: #{e.message}" }
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            

            

                    Rails.logger.error { e.backtrace.join("\n") }
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            

            

                    nil
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            

            

                  end
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            

            

                end
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            

            

            
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            

            

                private
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            

            

            
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            

            

                # Try to find a metric with retries to handle race conditions
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            

            

                # @param metric_id [String, Integer] The ID of the metric to find
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            

            

                # @param max_attempts [Integer] Maximum number of retry attempts
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            

            

                # @param delay [Float] Delay between retries in seconds
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            

            

                # @return [Domain::Metric, nil] The found metric or nil if not found
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            

            

                def find_metric_with_retry(metric_id, max_attempts = 5, delay = 0.2)
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            

            

                  attempts = 0
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            

            

                  metric_id_str = metric_id.to_s
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            

            

            
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            

            

                  while attempts < max_attempts
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            

            

                    # Try normal repository lookup first
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            

            

                    metric = @storage_port.find_metric(metric_id)
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            

            

                    return metric if metric
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            

            

            
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            

            

                    # If that fails, try direct database lookup as a fallback
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            

            

                    if attempts > 1
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            

            

                      begin
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            

            

                        Rails.logger.debug { "Trying direct database lookup for metric #{metric_id_str}" }
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            

            

            
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            

            

                        # Try using our new direct database method first
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            

            

                        domain_metric = DomainMetric.find_by_id_direct(metric_id_str.to_i)
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            

            

            
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            

            

                        if domain_metric
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            

            

                          Rails.logger.debug { "Found metric via find_by_id_direct: #{domain_metric.id} (#{domain_metric.name})" }
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            

            

                          return Domain::Metric.new(
          
      76. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    76. 
            

            

                            id: domain_metric.id.to_s,
          
      77. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    77. 
            

            

                            name: domain_metric.name,
          
      78. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    78. 
            

            

                            value: domain_metric.value.to_f,
          
      79. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    79. 
            

            

                            source: domain_metric.source,
          
      80. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    80. 
            

            

                            dimensions: domain_metric.dimensions_hash || {},
          
      81. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    81. 
            

            

                            timestamp: domain_metric.recorded_at
          
      82. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    82. 
            

            

                          )
          
      83. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    83. 
            

            

                        end
          
      84. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    84. 
            

            

            
          
      85. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    85. 
            

            

                        # Fallback to raw SQL as a last resort
          
      86. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    86. 
            

            

                        ActiveRecord::Base.connection_pool.with_connection do |conn|
          
      87. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    87. 
            

            

                          # Use direct SQL query as a last resort, getting only the most recent metric
          
      88. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    88. 
            

            

                          # Check for both string ID and integer ID
          
      89. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    89. 
            

            

                          id_int = metric_id_str.to_i
          
      90. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    90. 
            

            

                          sql = "SELECT id, name, value, source, dimensions::text as dimensions_text, recorded_at FROM metrics WHERE id = $1 ORDER BY recorded_at DESC LIMIT 1"
          
      91. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    91. 
            

            

            
          
      92. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    92. 
            

            

                          # Use safer parameter binding without arrays
          
      93. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    93. 
            

            

                          result = conn.exec_query(sql, "Direct Metric Lookup", [id_int])
          
      94. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    94. 
            

            

            
          
      95. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    95. 
            

            

                          if result.rows.any?
          
      96. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    96. 
            

            

                            record = result.to_a.first
          
      97. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    97. 
            

            

            
          
      98. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    98. 
            

            

                            # Parse the JSONB dimensions field
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            

            

                            dimensions = {}
          
      100. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    100. 
            

            

                            if record["dimensions_text"].present?
          
      101. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    101. 
            

            

                              begin
          
      102. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    102. 
            

            

                                dimensions = JSON.parse(record["dimensions_text"])
          
      103. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    103. 
            

            

                              rescue JSON::ParserError => e
          
      104. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    104. 
            

            

                                Rails.logger.error { "Failed to parse dimensions JSON: #{e.message}" }
          
      105. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    105. 
            

            

                                dimensions = {}
          
      106. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    106. 
            

            

                              end
          
      107. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    107. 
            

            

                            end
          
      108. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    108. 
            

            

            
          
      109. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    109. 
            

            

                            # Create the domain metric directly
          
      110. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    110. 
            

            

                            Rails.logger.debug { "Found metric via direct SQL: #{record['id']} (#{record['name']})" }
          
      111. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    111. 
            

            

                            return Domain::Metric.new(
          
      112. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    112. 
            

            

                              id: record["id"].to_s,
          
      113. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    113. 
            

            

                              name: record["name"],
          
      114. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    114. 
            

            

                              value: record["value"].to_f,
          
      115. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    115. 
            

            

                              source: record["source"],
          
      116. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    116. 
            

            

                              dimensions: dimensions,
          
      117. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    117. 
            

            

                              timestamp: record["recorded_at"]
          
      118. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    118. 
            

            

                            )
          
      119. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    119. 
            

            

                          end
          
      120. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    120. 
            

            

                        end
          
      121. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    121. 
            

            

                      rescue StandardError => e
          
      122. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    122. 
            

            

                        Rails.logger.error { "Error in direct database lookup: #{e.message}" }
          
      123. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    123. 
            

            

                        Rails.logger.error { e.backtrace.join("\n") }
          
      124. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    124. 
            

            

                      end
          
      125. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    125. 
            

            

                    end
          
      126. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    126. 
            

            

            
          
      127. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    127. 
            

            

                    attempts += 1
          
      128. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    128. 
            

            

                    next unless attempts < max_attempts
          
      129. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    129. 
            

            

            
          
      130. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    130. 
            

            

                    Rails.logger.debug do
          
      131. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    131. 
            

            

                      "Metric with ID #{metric_id} not found, retrying (attempt #{attempts}/#{max_attempts})..."
          
      132. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    132. 
            

            

                    end
          
      133. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    133. 
            

            

                    sleep(delay * attempts) # Increase delay with each attempt
          
      134. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    134. 
            

            

                  end
          
      135. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    135. 
            

            

            
          
      136. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    136. 
            

            

                  nil
          
      137. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    137. 
            

            

                end
          
      138. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    138. 
            

            

            
          
      139. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    139. 
            

            

                def determine_severity(metric, threshold)
          
      140. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    140. 
            

            

                  # Calculate how much the metric exceeds the threshold
          
      141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    141. 
            

            

                  excess_percentage = ((metric.value - threshold) / threshold) * 100
          
      142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    142. 
            

            

            
          
      143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    143. 
            

            

                  if excess_percentage > 50
          
      144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    144. 
            

            

                    :critical
          
      145. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    145. 
            

            

                  elsif excess_percentage > 20
          
      146. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    146. 
            

            

                    :warning
          
      147. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    147. 
            

            

                  else
          
      148. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    148. 
            

            

                    :info
          
      149. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    149. 
            

            

                  end
          
      150. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    150. 
            

            

                end
          
      151. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    151. 
            

            

              end
          
      152. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    152. 
            

            

            end
          
      153.

              class FindAlert

                def initialize(storage_port:)
          
      4.

                  @storage_port = storage_port
          
      5. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    5. 
            

            

                end
          
      6. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    6. 
            

            

            
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            

            

                def call(id)
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            

            

                  alert = @storage_port.find_alert(id)
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            

            

                  raise ArgumentError, "Alert with ID '#{id}' not found" if alert.nil?
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            

            

            
          
      11.

              # FindEvent use case retrieves an event from the storage port

              class FindEvent

                def initialize(storage_port:)
          
      5. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    5. 
            

            

                  @storage_port = storage_port

    6. 
            

            

                end
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            

            

            
          
      8.

                # Find an event by its ID
          
      9.

                #

                # @param id [String] The ID of the event to find

                # @return [Domain::Event, nil] The event if found, nil otherwise

              class FindMetric

    app/core/use_cases/process_event.rb

    0.0% lines covered

    37 relevant lines. 0 lines covered and 37 lines missed. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1. 
            

            

            module UseCases
          
      2. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    2. 
            

            

              class ProcessEvent
          
      3. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    3. 
            

            

                def initialize(ingestion_port:, storage_port:, queue_port:)
          
      4. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    4. 
            

            

                  @ingestion_port = ingestion_port
          
      5. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    5. 
            

            

                  @storage_port = storage_port
          
      6. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    6. 
            

            

                  @queue_port = queue_port
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            

            

                end
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            

            

            
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            

            

                # Process a raw webhook payload
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            

            

                # @param raw_payload [String] The raw JSON webhook payload
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            

            

                # @param source [String] The source of the webhook (github, jira, etc.)
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            

            

                # @return [Domain::Event] The processed domain event
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            

            

                def call(raw_payload, source:)
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            

            

                  Rails.logger.debug { "ProcessEvent.call starting for #{source} event" }
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            

            

            
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            

            

                  # Parse the raw payload into a domain event
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            

            

                  begin
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            

            

                    event = @ingestion_port.receive_event(raw_payload, source: source)
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            

            

                    Rails.logger.debug { "Event parsed: #{event.id} (#{event.name})" }
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            

            

                  rescue StandardError => e
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            

            

                    Rails.logger.error("Error parsing event: #{e.message}")
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            

            

                    raise EventParsingError, "Failed to parse event: #{e.message}"
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            

            

                  end
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            

            

            
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            

            

                  # Store the event in the repository
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            

            

                  begin
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            

            

                    stored_event = @storage_port.save_event(event)
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            

            

                    event = stored_event
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            

            

                    Rails.logger.debug { "Event saved: #{event.id}" }
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            

            

                  rescue StandardError => e
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            

            

                    Rails.logger.error("Error saving event: #{e.message}")
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            

            

                    raise EventStorageError, "Failed to save event: #{e.message}"
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            

            

                  end
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            

            

            
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            

            

                  # Enqueue for async metric calculation
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            

            

                  begin
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            

            

                    @queue_port.enqueue_metric_calculation(event)
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            

            

                    Rails.logger.debug { "Event enqueued for metric calculation: #{event.id}" }
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            

            

                  rescue StandardError => e
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            

            

                    Rails.logger.error("Error enqueuing event: #{e.message}")
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            

            

                    # We don't want to fail the whole process if enqueueing fails
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            

            

                    # The event is already stored, so it can be recovered later
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            

            

                    Rails.logger.error("Continuing despite enqueueing error")
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            

            

                  end
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            

            

            
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            

            

                  # Return the processed event
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            

            

                  event
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            

            

                end
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            

            

            
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            

            

                # Custom error classes for clearer exception handling
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            

            

                class EventParsingError < StandardError; end
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            

            

                class EventStorageError < StandardError; end
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            

            

              end
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            

            

            end
          
      55.

                def call(alert_id)

            class DomainAlert < ApplicationRecord
          
      2. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    2. 
            

            

              validates :name, presence: true
          
      3. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    3. 
            

            

              validates :severity, presence: true, inclusion: { in: ["info", "warning", "critical"] }
          
      4. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    4. 
            

            

              validates :metric_data, presence: true
          
      5. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    5. 
            

            

              validates :threshold, presence: true
          
      6. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    6. 
            

            

              validates :status, presence: true, inclusion: { in: ["active", "acknowledged", "resolved"] }
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            

            

              validates :timestamp, presence: true
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            

            

            
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            

            

              scope :active, -> { where(status: "active") }
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            

            

              scope :by_severity, ->(severity) { where(severity: severity) }
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            

            

              scope :critical, -> { where(severity: "critical") }
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            

            

              scope :warning, -> { where(severity: "warning") }
          
      13.

              scope :info, -> { where(severity: "info") }
          
      14.

              scope :recent, ->(limit = 10) { order(timestamp: :desc).limit(limit) }

              # Create sample alerts for testing and demonstration

              def self.create_sample_alerts(count = 5)

                # Sample alert data

                # Create sample alerts

                  # Create sample metric data

                  metric_data = {

              def to_domain_model
          
      65.

              def self.from_domain_model(alert)

                domain_alert = find_by(id: alert.id) if alert.id.present?
          
      96. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    96. 
            

            

            
          
      97. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    97. 
            

            

                attributes = {
          
      98. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    98. 
            

            

                  name: alert.name,
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            

            

                  severity: alert.severity.to_s,
          
      100. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    100. 
            

            

                  metric_data: metric_data,
          
      101. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    101. 
            

            

                  threshold: alert.threshold,
          
      102. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    102.

      103. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    103. 
            

            

                  timestamp: alert.timestamp
          
      104. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    104. 
            

            

                }
          
      105. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    105. 
            

            

            
          
      106. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    106. 
            

            

                if domain_alert
          
      107. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    107. 
            

            

                  domain_alert.update!(attributes)
          
      108. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    108. 
            

            

                  domain_alert
          
      109. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    109. 
            

            

                else
          
      110. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    110.

      111.

                end
          
      112. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    112. 
            

            

              end

            end

            class DomainMetric < ApplicationRecord

              self.table_name = "metrics"

    3. 
            

            

            
          
      4. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    4. 
            

            

              # Since our metrics table has a composite primary key (id, recorded_at),
          
      5. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    5. 
            

            

              # we need to be careful in how we handle it
          
      6. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    6.

              # Scopes for efficient querying

              scope :latest_first, -> { order(recorded_at: :desc) }

              # Method to find by ID only (getting the most recent record when multiple records have the same ID)
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            

            

              # This is useful for when we only have the ID part of the composite key
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            

            

              def self.find_by_id_only(id)
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            

            

                return nil if id.nil?
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            

            

            
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            

            

                # Ensure we're working with an integer ID
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            

            

                id_int = id.is_a?(String) ? id.to_i : id
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            

            

            
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            

            

                # Log what we're looking for
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            

            

                Rails.logger.debug { "Looking for metric with ID: #{id_int} (find_by_id_only)" }
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            

            

            
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            

            

                # Get the most recent entry with this ID
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            

            

                result = where(id: id_int).order(recorded_at: :desc).first
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            

            

            
          
      36.

    38.

      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39.

    40. 
            

            

                end
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41.

              # Direct database accessor to avoid ActiveRecord issues with composite keys

              def self.find_by_id_direct(id)
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            

            

                return nil if id.nil?
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            

            

            
          
      49.

                Rails.logger.debug { "Direct DB lookup for metric ID: #{id_int}" }
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            

            

            
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            

            

                begin
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53.

                    if result.rows.any?

                      record = result.to_a.first.symbolize_keys
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            

            

            
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            

            

                      # Parse the JSONB dimensions field
