                      # Create DomainMetric with parsed dimensions

              # Class methods for analytics

              def self.average_for(name, start_time = nil, end_time = nil)
          
      93. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    93. 
            

            

                scope = with_name(name)
          
      94. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    94. 
            

            

                scope = scope.between(start_time, end_time) if start_time && end_time
          
      95. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    95. 
            

            

                scope.average(:value)
          
      96. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    96. 
            

            

              end
          
      97. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    97. 
            

            

            
          
      98. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    98. 
            

            

              def self.percentile_for(name, percentile, start_time = nil, end_time = nil)
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            

            

                scope = with_name(name)
          
      100. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    100. 
            

            

                scope = scope.between(start_time, end_time) if start_time && end_time
          
      101. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    101. 
            

            

            
          
      102. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    102. 
            

            

                # Simplified percentile calculation for PostgreSQL
          
      103. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    103. 
            

            

                # In a real implementation, you might use a more sophisticated approach
          
      104. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    104. 
            

            

                # or leverage PostgreSQL's percentile_cont function
          
      105. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    105. 
            

            

                values = scope.pluck(:value).sort
          
      106. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    106. 
            

            

                return nil if values.empty?
          
      107. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    107. 
            

            

            
          
      108. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    108. 
            

            

                k = (percentile / 100.0) * (values.size - 1)
          
      109. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    109. 
            

            

                f = k.floor
          
      110. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    110. 
            

            

                c = k.ceil
          
      111. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    111. 
            

            

            
          
      112. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    112. 
            

            

                if f == c
          
      113. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    113. 
            

            

                  values[f]
          
      114. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    114. 
            

            

                else
          
      115. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    115. 
            

            

                  ((values[f] * (c - k)) + (values[c] * (k - f)))
          
      116. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    116. 
            

            

                end
          
      117. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    117. 
            

            

              end
          
      118. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    118. 
            

            

            end
          
      119.

              # Enqueues a domain event for metric calculation

              # Get recent alerts

    9. 
            

            

              def recent_alerts(limit: 5, severity: nil, days: nil)

    10. 
            

            

                filters = { latest_first: true, limit: limit }

    11. 
            

            

                filters[:severity] = severity if severity

    12.

    13.

    14. 
            

            

                # First, try to get real alerts from the storage port

    15.

    16. 
            

            

            
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            

            

                # If no real alerts, try to create some sample alerts first

      19.

      20.

            # Service for calculating DORA (DevOps Research and Assessment) metrics
          
      4. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    4. 
            

            

            # https://cloud.google.com/blog/products/devops-sre/using-the-four-keys-to-measure-your-devops-performance
          
      5. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    5. 
            

            

            class DoraService
          
      6. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    6. 
            

            

              def initialize(storage_port:)
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            

            

                @storage_port = storage_port
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8.

      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            

            

            
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            

            

              # Calculate deployment frequency (deployments per day)
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            

            

              def deployment_frequency(days = 30)
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            

            

                start_time = days.days.ago
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            

            

            
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            

            

                Rails.logger.info("Calculating deployment frequency for past #{days} days")
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            

            

            
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            

            

                deployments = @storage_port.list_metrics(
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            

            

                  name: "ci.deploy.completed",
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            

            

                  start_time: start_time
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            

            

                )
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            

            

            
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            

            

                Rails.logger.info("Found #{deployments.count} total deployments")
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            

            

            
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            

            

                # Group by day
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            

            

                deployments_by_day = deployments.group_by do |metric|
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            

            

                  metric.timestamp.strftime("%Y-%m-%d")
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            

            

                end
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            

            

            
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            

            

                # Debug info about deployments by day
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            

            

                if deployments_by_day.any?
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            

            

                  Rails.logger.info("Deployment dates: #{deployments_by_day.keys.sort.join(', ')}")
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            

            

                else
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            

            

                  Rails.logger.warn("No deployments found in the specified time period")
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            

            

                end
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            

            

            
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            

            

                # Count days with at least one deployment
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            

            

                days_with_deployments = deployments_by_day.keys.size
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            

            

            
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            

            

                Rails.logger.info("Days with at least one deployment: #{days_with_deployments}")
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            

            

            
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            

            

                # Calculate frequency
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            

            

                if days_with_deployments > 0
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            

            

                  frequency = (days_with_deployments.to_f / days).round(2)
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            

            

                  rating = deployment_frequency_rating(frequency)
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            

            

            
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            

            

                  Rails.logger.info("Deployment frequency: #{frequency} per day, Rating: #{rating}")
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            

            

            
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            

            

                  {
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            

            

                    value: frequency,
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            

            

                    rating: rating,
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            

            

                    days_with_deployments: days_with_deployments,
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            

            

                    total_days: days,
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            

            

                    total_deployments: deployments.count
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            

            

                  }
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            

            

                else
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            

            

                  Rails.logger.warn("No deployments found - returning 'low' rating")
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            

            

            
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            

            

                  {
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            

            

                    value: 0,
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            

            

                    rating: "low",
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            

            

                    days_with_deployments: 0,
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            

            

                    total_days: days,
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            

            

                    total_deployments: 0
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            

            

                  }
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            

            

                end
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            

            

              end
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            

            

            
          
      67.

              # Calculate lead time for changes (time from commit to production)
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            

            

              def lead_time_for_changes(days = 30)
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            

            

                start_time = days.days.ago
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            

            

            
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            

            

                # Get lead time metrics
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            

            

                lead_time_metrics = @storage_port.list_metrics(
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            

            

                  name: "ci.lead_time",
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            

            

                  start_time: start_time
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            

            

                )
          
      76. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    76. 
            

            

            
          
      77. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    77. 
            

            

                if lead_time_metrics.any?
          
      78. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    78. 
            

            

                  avg_lead_time_hours = lead_time_metrics.sum(&:value) / lead_time_metrics.size / 3600
          
      79. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    79. 
            

            

            
          
      80. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    80. 
            

            

                  {
          
      81. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    81. 
            

            

                    value: avg_lead_time_hours.round(2),
          
      82. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    82. 
            

            

                    rating: lead_time_rating(avg_lead_time_hours),
          
      83. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    83. 
            

            

                    sample_size: lead_time_metrics.size
          
      84. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    84. 
            

            

                  }
          
      85. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    85. 
            

            

                else
          
      86. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    86. 
            

            

                  { value: 0, rating: "unknown", sample_size: 0 }
          
      87. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    87. 
            

            

                end
          
      88. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    88. 
            

            

              end
          
      89.

              # Calculate time to restore service (MTTR)
          
      91. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    91. 
            

            

              def time_to_restore_service(days = 30)
          
      92. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    92. 
            

            

                start_time = days.days.ago
          
      93. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    93. 
            

            

            
          
      94. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    94. 
            

            

                # Get incident resolution metrics
          
      95. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    95. 
            

            

                restoration_metrics = @storage_port.list_metrics(
          
      96. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    96. 
            

            

                  name: "incident.resolution_time",
          
      97. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    97. 
            

            

                  start_time: start_time
          
      98. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    98. 
            

            

                )
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            

            

            
          
      100. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    100. 
            

            

                if restoration_metrics.any?
          
      101. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    101. 
            

            

                  avg_restore_time_hours = restoration_metrics.sum(&:value) / restoration_metrics.size / 3600
          
      102. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    102. 
            

            

            
          
      103. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    103. 
            

            

                  {
          
      104. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    104. 
            

            

                    value: avg_restore_time_hours.round(2),
          
      105. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    105. 
            

            

                    rating: restore_time_rating(avg_restore_time_hours),
          
      106. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    106. 
            

            

                    sample_size: restoration_metrics.size
          
      107. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    107. 
            

            

                  }
          
      108. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    108. 
            

            

                else
          
      109. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    109. 
            

            

                  { value: 0, rating: "unknown", sample_size: 0 }

              # Calculate change failure rate (% of deployments causing incidents)
          
      114. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    114. 
            

            

              def change_failure_rate(days = 30)
          
      115. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    115. 
            

            

                start_time = days.days.ago
          
      116. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    116. 
            

            

            
          
      117. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    117. 
            

            

                # Get deployment metrics
          
      118. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    118. 
            

            

                deployments = @storage_port.list_metrics(
          
      119. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    119. 
            

            

                  name: "ci.deploy.completed",
          
      120. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    120. 
            

            

                  start_time: start_time
          
      121. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    121. 
            

            

                )
          
      122. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    122. 
            

            

            
          
      123. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    123. 
            

            

                # Get failed deployment metrics
          
      124. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    124. 
            

            

                failed_deployments = @storage_port.list_metrics(
          
      125. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    125. 
            

            

                  name: "ci.deploy.incident",
          
      126. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    126. 
            

            

                  start_time: start_time
          
      127. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    127. 
            

            

                )
          
      128. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    128. 
            

            

            
          
      129. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    129. 
            

            

                total_deployments = deployments.sum(&:value)
          
      130. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    130. 
            

            

                total_failures = failed_deployments.sum(&:value)
          
      131. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    131. 
            

            

            
          
      132. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    132. 
            

            

                if total_deployments > 0
          
      133. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    133. 
            

            

                  failure_rate = (total_failures.to_f / total_deployments * 100).round(2)
          
      134. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    134. 
            

            

            
          
      135. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    135. 
            

            

                  {
          
      136. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    136. 
            

            

                    value: failure_rate,
          
      137. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    137. 
            

            

                    rating: failure_rate_rating(failure_rate),
          
      138. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    138. 
            

            

                    failures: total_failures,
          
      139. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    139. 
            

            

                    deployments: total_deployments
          
      140. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    140. 
            

            

                  }
          
      141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    141. 
            

            

                else
          
      142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    142. 
            

            

                  { value: 0, rating: "unknown", failures: 0, deployments: 0 }
          
      143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    143. 
            

            

                end
          
      144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    144. 
            

            

              end
          
      145. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    145. 
            

            

            
          
      146. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    146. 
            

            

              private
          
      147. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    147. 
            

            

            
          
      148. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    148. 
            

            

              # Rating systems based on DORA research
          
      149. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    149. 
            

            

            
          
      150. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    150. 
            

            

              def deployment_frequency_rating(deployments_per_day)
          
      151. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    151. 
            

            

                if deployments_per_day >= 1
          
      152. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    152. 
            

            

                  "elite"       # Multiple deploys per day
          
      153. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    153. 
            

            

                elsif deployments_per_day >= 0.14
          
      154. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    154. 
            

            

                  "high"        # Between once per day and once per week
          
      155. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    155. 
            

            

                elsif deployments_per_day >= 0.03
          
      156. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    156. 
            

            

                  "medium"      # Between once per week and once per month
          
      157. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    157. 
            

            

                else
          
      158. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    158. 
            

            

                  "low"         # Less than once per month
          
      159. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    159. 
            

            

                end
          
      160. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    160. 
            

            

              end
          
      161. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    161. 
            

            

            
          
      162. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    162. 
            

            

              def lead_time_rating(hours)
          
      163. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    163. 
            

            

                if hours <= 24
          
      164. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    164. 
            

            

                  "elite"       # Less than one day
          
      165. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    165. 
            

            

                elsif hours <= 168
          
      166. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    166. 
            

            

                  "high"        # Less than one week
          
      167. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    167. 
            

            

                elsif hours <= 730
          
      168. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    168. 
            

            

                  "medium"      # Less than one month
          
      169. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    169. 
            

            

                else
          
      170. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    170. 
            

            

                  "low"         # More than one month
          
      171. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    171. 
            

            

                end
          
      172. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    172. 
            

            

              end
          
      173. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    173. 
            

            

            
          
      174. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    174. 
            

            

              def restore_time_rating(hours)
          
      175. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    175. 
            

            

                if hours < 1
          
      176. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    176. 
            

            

                  "elite"       # Less than one hour
          
      177. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    177. 
            

            

                elsif hours < 24
          
      178. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    178. 
            

            

                  "high"        # Less than one day
          
      179. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    179. 
            

            

                elsif hours < 168
          
      180. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    180. 
            

            

                  "medium"      # Less than one week
          
      181. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    181. 
            

            

                else
          
      182. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    182. 
            

            

                  "low"         # More than one week
          
      183. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    183. 
            

            

                end
          
      184. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    184. 
            

            

              end
          
      185. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    185. 
            

            

            
          
      186. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    186. 
            

            

              def failure_rate_rating(percentage)
          
      187. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    187. 
            

            

                if percentage <= 15
          
      188. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    188. 
            

            

                  "elite"       # 0-15%
          
      189. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    189. 
            

            

                elsif percentage <= 30
          
      190. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    190. 
            

            

                  "high"        # 16-30%
          
      191. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    191. 
            

            

                elsif percentage <= 45
          
      192. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    192. 
            

            

                  "medium"      # 31-45%
          
      193. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    193. 
            

            

                else
          
      194. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    194. 
            

            

                  "low"         # 46-100%
          
      195. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    195. 
            

            

                end
          
      196. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    196. 
            

            

              end
          
      197. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    197. 
            

            

            end
          
      198.

    app/services/metrics_service.rb

    0.0% lines covered

    98 relevant lines. 0 lines covered and 98 lines missed. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1. 
            

            

            # frozen_string_literal: true
          
      2. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    2. 
            

            

            
          
      3. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    3. 
            

            

            class MetricsService
          
      4. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    4. 
            

            

              def initialize(storage_port:, cache_port:)
          
      5. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    5. 
            

            

                @storage_port = storage_port
          
      6. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    6. 
            

            

                @cache_port = cache_port
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            

            

              end
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            

            

            
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            

            

              # Get aggregate metrics with time period grouping
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            

            

              def aggregate_metrics(metric_name, time_period = "daily", days = 7)
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            

            

                start_time = days.days.ago
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            

            

            
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            

            

                metrics = @storage_port.list_metrics(
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            

            

                  name: metric_name,
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            

            

                  start_time: start_time,
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            

            

                  latest_first: true
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            

            

                )
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            

            

            
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            

            

                # Group by time period
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            

            

                metrics.group_by do |metric|
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            

            

                  case time_period
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            

            

                  when "daily"
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            

            

                    metric.timestamp.strftime("%Y-%m-%d")
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            

            

                  when "weekly"
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            

            

                    metric.timestamp.beginning_of_week.strftime("%Y-%m-%d")
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            

            

                  when "monthly"
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            

            

                    metric.timestamp.strftime("%Y-%m")
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            

            

                  else
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            

            

                    metric.timestamp.strftime("%Y-%m-%d")
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            

            

                  end
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            

            

                end.transform_values do |metrics_for_period|
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            

            

                  metrics_for_period.sum(&:value)
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            

            

                end
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            

            

              end
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            

            

            
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            

            

              # Get top metrics by a specific dimension
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            

            

              def top_metrics(metric_name, dimension:, limit: 5, days: 30)
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            

            

                start_time = days.days.ago
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            

            

            
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            

            

                metrics = @storage_port.list_metrics(
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            

            

                  name: metric_name,
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            

            

                  start_time: start_time
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            

            

                )
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            

            

            
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            

            

                # Group by the specified dimension
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            

            

                grouped = metrics.group_by do |metric|
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            

            

                  metric.dimensions[dimension.to_s] || metric.dimensions[dimension.to_sym] || "unknown"
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            

            

                end
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            

            

            
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            

            

                # Sum values and sort
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            

            

                sorted = grouped.transform_values do |dimension_metrics|
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            

            

                  dimension_metrics.sum(&:value)
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            

            

                end.sort_by { |_, value| -value }
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            

            

            
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            

            

                # Return top N results
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            

            

                sorted.first(limit).to_h
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            

            

              end
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            

            

            
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            

            

              # Calculate success rate for CI/CD operations
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            

            

              def success_rate(metric_base_name, days = 30)
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            

            

                start_time = days.days.ago
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            

            

            
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            

            

                success_metrics = @storage_port.list_metrics(
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            

            

                  name: "#{metric_base_name}.completed",
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            

            

                  start_time: start_time
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            

            

                )
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            

            

            
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            

            

                total_metrics = @storage_port.list_metrics(
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            

            

                  name: "#{metric_base_name}.total",
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            

            

                  start_time: start_time
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            

            

                )
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            

            

            
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            

            

                total_count = total_metrics.sum(&:value)
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            

            

                success_count = success_metrics.sum(&:value)
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            

            

            
          
      76. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    76. 
            

            

                # Ensure we don't return more than 100%, which can happen if we have more
          
      77. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    77. 
            

            

                # completed metrics than total metrics (data inconsistency)
          
      78. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    78. 
            

            

                if total_count > 0
          
      79. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    79. 
            

            

                  rate = (success_count.to_f / total_count * 100).round(2)
          
      80. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    80. 
            

            

                  # Cap the success rate at 100%
          
      81. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    81. 
            

            

                  [rate, 100.0].min
          
      82. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    82. 
            

            

                else
          
      83. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    83. 
            

            

                  0
          
      84. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    84. 
            

            

                end
          
      85. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    85. 
            

            

              end
          
      86. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    86. 
            

            

            
          
      87. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    87. 
            

            

              # Calculate average for a metric
          
      88. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    88. 
            

            

              def average_metric(metric_name, days = 30)
          
      89. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    89. 
            

            

                start_time = days.days.ago
          
      90. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    90. 
            

            

                end_time = Time.now
          
      91. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    91. 
            

            

            
          
      92. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    92. 
            

            

                @storage_port.get_average(metric_name, start_time, end_time)
          
      93. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    93. 
            

            

              end
          
      94. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    94. 
            

            

            
          
      95. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    95. 
            

            

              # Calculate team velocity (completed tasks per week)
          
      96. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    96. 
            

            

              def team_velocity(weeks = 4)
          
      97. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    97. 
            

            

                start_time = weeks.weeks.ago
          
      98. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    98. 
            

            

            
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            

            

                # Use direct query for task metrics because the repository's name_pattern doesn't work as expected
          
      100. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    100. 
            

            

                task_metrics = []
          
      101. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    101. 
            

            

            
          
      102. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    102. 
            

            

                # Use the DomainMetric model directly with a SQL LIKE clause
          
      103. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    103. 
            

            

                domain_metrics = DomainMetric.where("name LIKE 'task.%.total'")
          
      104. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    104. 
            

            

                                             .where("recorded_at >= ?", start_time)
          
      105. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    105. 
            

            

                                             .order(recorded_at: :desc)
          
      106. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    106. 
            

            

            
          
      107. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    107. 
            

            

                # Convert database records to domain models
          
      108. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    108. 
            

            

                task_metrics = domain_metrics.map do |record|
          
      109. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    109. 
            

            

                  Domain::Metric.new(
          
      110. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    110. 
            

            

                    id: record.id.to_s,
          
      111. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    111. 
            

            

                    name: record.name,
          
      112. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    112. 
            

            

                    value: record.value,
          
      113. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    113. 
            

            

                    source: record.source,
          
      114. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    114. 
            

            

                    dimensions: record.dimensions || {},
          
      115. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    115. 
            

            

                    timestamp: record.recorded_at
          
      116. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    116. 
            

            

                  )
          
      117. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    117. 
            

            

                end
          
      118. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    118. 
            

            

            
          
      119. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    119. 
            

            

                Rails.logger.info("Found #{task_metrics.size} task metrics for velocity calculation")
          
      120. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    120. 
            

            

            
          
      121. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    121. 
            

            

                # Group by week and calculate sums
          
      122. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    122. 
            

            

                velocity_by_week = task_metrics.group_by do |metric|
          
      123. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    123. 
            

            

                  metric.timestamp.beginning_of_week.strftime("%Y-%m-%d")
          
      124. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    124. 
            

            

                end.transform_values do |weekly_metrics|
          
      125. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    125. 
            

            

                  weekly_metrics.sum(&:value)
          
      126. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    126. 
            

            

                end
          
      127. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    127. 
            

            

            
          
      128. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    128. 
            

            

                # Calculate average weekly velocity
          
      129. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    129. 
            

            

                values = velocity_by_week.values
          
      130. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    130. 
            

            

            
          
      131. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    131. 
            

            

                # If we have data, calculate the average, otherwise return 0
          
      132. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    132. 
            

            

                if values.any?
          
      133. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    133. 
            

            

                  average_velocity = (values.sum.to_f / values.size).round(2)
          
      134. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    134. 
            

            

                  Rails.logger.info("Calculated average velocity: #{average_velocity} tasks per week")
          
      135. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    135. 
            

            

                  average_velocity
          
      136. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    136. 
            

            

                else
          
      137. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    137. 
            

            

                  Rails.logger.warn("No task metrics found for velocity calculation")
          
      138. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    138. 
            

            

                  0
          
      139. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    139. 
            

            

                end
          
      140. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    140. 
            

            

              end
          
      141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    141. 
            

            

            end
          
      142.

            # WebhookAuthenticator provides methods to validate webhook tokens for different sources
          
      4. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    4. 
            

            

            class WebhookAuthenticator
          
      5. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    5. 
            

            

              # Validates a webhook token for a specific source
          
      6. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    6. 
            

            

              #
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            

            

              # @param token [String] The token to validate
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            

            

              # @param source [String] The source system (github, jira, etc.)
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            

            

              # @return [Boolean] Whether the token is valid
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            

            

              def self.valid?(token, source)
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            

            

                # In development mode, skip authentication
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            

            

                return true if Rails.env.local?
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            

            

            
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            

            

                expected_token = case source
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            

            

                                 when "github"
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            

            

                                   Rails.logger.info("GitHub webhook validation - Token received: #{token&.first(4)}*****")
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            

            

                                   github_token = ENV.fetch("GITHUB_WEBHOOK_TOKEN", nil)
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            

            

                                   Rails.logger.info("GitHub webhook validation - Expected token from ENV: #{github_token&.first(4)}*****")
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            

            

                                   Rails.logger.info("GitHub webhook ENV keys available: #{ENV.keys.grep(/GITHUB/).join(', ')}")
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            

            

                                   github_token
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            

            

                                 when "jira"
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            

            

                                   ENV.fetch("JIRA_WEBHOOK_TOKEN", nil)
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            

            

                                 when "gitlab"
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            

            

                                   ENV.fetch("GITLAB_WEBHOOK_TOKEN", nil)
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            

            

                                 when "bitbucket"
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            

            

                                   ENV.fetch("BITBUCKET_WEBHOOK_TOKEN", nil)
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            

            

                                 else
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            

            

                                   # For unknown sources, always require a custom token
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            

            

                                   ENV.fetch("#{source.upcase}_WEBHOOK_TOKEN", nil)
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            

            

                                 end
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            

            

            
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            

            

                is_valid = token == expected_token
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            

            

                Rails.logger.info("Webhook authentication for #{source} - Result: #{is_valid ? 'Valid' : 'Invalid'}")
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            

            

                is_valid
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            

            

              end
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            

            

            
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            

            

              # Get the configured secret for a webhook source
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            

            

              #
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            

            

              # @param source [String] The webhook source identifier
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            

            

              # @return [String, nil] The secret token or nil if not configured
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            

            

              def self.secret_for(source)
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            

            

                # In production, these would be stored in credentials or environment variables
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            

            

                # and accessed through Rails.application.credentials or ENV
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            

            

                case source
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            

            

                when "github"
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            

            

                  # Log all environment variables related to GitHub to help debug
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            

            

                  github_env_vars = ENV.keys.grep(/GITHUB/).map { |k| "#{k}: #{ENV[k] ? 'set' : 'not set'}" }
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            

            

                  Rails.logger.info("All GitHub-related ENV variables: #{github_env_vars.join(', ')}")
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            

            

            
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            

            

                  # Check specific environment variables

    51. 
            

            

                  github_secret = ENV.fetch("GITHUB_WEBHOOK_SECRET", nil)
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            

            

                  github_secret_key = ENV.fetch("GITHUB_WEBHOOK_SECRET_KEY", nil)
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            

            

                  github_secret_token = ENV.fetch("GITHUB_SECRET_TOKEN", nil)
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            

            

            
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            

            

                  # Check credentials
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            

            

                  credential_secret = defined?(Rails) && Rails.application.try(:credentials).try(:dig, :github, :webhook_secret)
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            

            

            
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            

            

                  # Log detailed information about all possible secret locations
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            

            

                  Rails.logger.info("GitHub webhook secret sources:")
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            

            

                  Rails.logger.info("- GITHUB_WEBHOOK_SECRET ENV: #{github_secret ? 'Present' : 'Missing'}")
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            

            

                  Rails.logger.info("- GITHUB_WEBHOOK_SECRET_KEY ENV: #{github_secret_key ? 'Present' : 'Missing'}")
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62.

      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            

            

                  Rails.logger.info("- Rails credentials github.webhook_secret: #{credential_secret ? 'Present' : 'Missing'}")
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            

            

            
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            

            

                  # Try all possible environment variable names
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            

            

                  secret = github_secret || github_secret_key || github_secret_token || credential_secret
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            

            

            
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            

            

                  if secret
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            

            

                    Rails.logger.info("GitHub webhook secret found (first 4 chars): #{secret.first(4)}****")
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            

            

                    secret
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            

            

                  else
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            

            

                    Rails.logger.warn("No GitHub webhook secret found in any location, using demo_secret_token")
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            

            

                    "demo_secret_token"
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            

            

                  end
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            

            

                when "jira"
          
      76. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    76. 
            

            

                  ENV["JIRA_WEBHOOK_SECRET"] ||
          
      77. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    77. 
            

            

                    (defined?(Rails) && Rails.application.try(:credentials).try(:dig, :jira, :webhook_secret)) ||
          
      78. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    78. 
            

            

                    "demo_secret_token"
          
      79.

      87.

                else
          
      88.

                  # Default token for other sources, or nil for security
          
      89.

                  ENV["DEFAULT_WEBHOOK_SECRET"] ||

              end
          
      94.

      95. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    95. 
            

            

              # Helper method to check if a value is blank
          
      96. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    96. 
            

            

              # This reproduces ActiveSupport's blank? method for when it's not available
          
      97. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    97. 
            

            

              #
          
      98. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    98. 
            

            

              # @param value [Object] The value to check
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            

            

              # @return [Boolean] True if the value is nil, empty, or contains only whitespace
          
      100. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    100. 
            

            

              def self.blank?(value)
          
      101. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    101. 
            

            

                value.nil? || (value.respond_to?(:empty?) && value.empty?) ||
          
      102. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    102. 
            

            

                  (value.is_a?(String) && value.strip.empty?)
          
      103. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    103. 
            

            

              end
          
      104. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    104. 
            

            

            end
          
      105.

    app/sidekiq/anomaly_detection_job.rb

    0.0% lines covered

            class AnomalyDetectionJob
          
      4. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    4. 
            

            

              include Sidekiq::Job
          
      5. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    5. 
            

            

            
          
      6. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    6. 
            

            

              # Set queue name and retry options
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            

            

              sidekiq_options queue: "anomaly_detection", retry: 3
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            

            

            
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            

            

              # Process anomaly detection for a metric
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            

            

              # @param metric_id [String] The ID of the metric to analyze
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            

            

              def perform(metric_id)
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            

            

                alert = UseCaseFactory.create_detect_anomalies.call(metric_id)
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            

            

                log_result(metric_id, alert)
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            

            

              rescue StandardError => e
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            

            

                Rails.logger.error("Error in AnomalyDetectionJob: #{e.message}")
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            

            

                raise
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            

            

              end
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            

            

            
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            

            

              private
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            

            

            
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            

            

              def log_result(metric_id, alert)
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            

            

                if alert
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            

            

                  Rails.logger.info("Alert created from metric #{metric_id}: #{alert.name}")
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            

            

                else
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            

            

                  Rails.logger.info("No anomalies detected for metric #{metric_id}")
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            

            

                end
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            

            

              end
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            

            

            end
          
      29.
